holidays.name: Figure It Out Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to puzzling through problems, riddles, and mysteries! It encourages people to use their detective skills and enjoy brain-teasing challenges.
holidays.origin: The exact origin is unclear, but it's believed to have started as a fun, informal observance encouraging curiosity and problem-solving at the start of the new year.
holidays.funFact: Some people celebrate by solving a new puzzle or brain teaser every January 16 to kickstart their year with mental clarity!

holidays.name: Nothing Day
holidays.description: A day to do absolutely nothing ‚Äî no celebrations, no special events, just a pause to relax and enjoy the absence of obligations.
holidays.origin: Proposed in 1973 by columnist Harold Pullman Coffin to create a day free from any observances and distractions.
holidays.funFact: Nothing Day is the only unofficial holiday that promotes doing... literally nothing, inspiring a guilt-free day of doing zilch!

holidays.funFact: The Fig Newton was named after Newton, Massachusetts ‚Äî but Americans mostly just think of it as the delicious fig-filled cookie!

holidays.name: Religious Freedom Day (USA)
holidays.description: Marks the day the Virginia Statute for Religious Freedom was enacted in 1786, guaranteeing freedom of religion and influencing the First Amendment.

holidays.funFact: The Virginia Statute for Religious Freedom was a groundbreaking law that inspired religious rights protections worldwide!
